intro: Myosotis virginica var. macrosperma, commonly known as the large-seeded bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are arranged in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. The seeds are large and often dispersed by wind, contributing to its natural distribution across its native range.
